Function.Description: The vectorSigmoidInnerProduct function returns the sigmoid exponential inner product of the two Number Vector arguments x1 and x2.

Brief.Overview:
The vectorSigmoidInnerProduct function returns the sigmoid exponential inner product of the two Number Vector arguments x1 and x2. The C formula used is as follows:

(/ 1.0 (+ 1.0 (exp (- (vectorInnerProduct x1 x2)))))
Brief.Usage: The vectorSigmoidInnerProduct function may be used as a kernel for support vector machine regression (see the svmRegression function).

Argument.Name: x1
Argument.Note: The first Number Vector to be multiplied

Argument.Name: x2
Argument.Note: The second Number Vector to be multiplied

Syntax.Return: The sigmoid exponential inner or dot product of the two vectors.
